title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
synopsis_xl: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country for which he fought.

title: The Post (2017)
synopsis_xl: A cover-up spanning four U.S. Presidents pushes the country's first female newspaper publisher and her editor to join an unprecedented battle between press and government.

title: Shawshank Redemption, The (1994)
synopsis_xl: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

title: Magician: The Astonishing Life and Work of Orson Welles (2014)
synopsis_xl: A look at the life and work of the great theatre, radio and film artist.

title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
synopsis_xl: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

title: Seven Psychopaths (2012)
synopsis_xl: A struggling screenwriter inadvertently becomes entangled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld after his oddball friends kidnap a gangster's beloved Shih Tzu.

title: Reservoir Dogs (1992)
synopsis_xl: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

title: Silence of the Lambs, The (1991)
synopsis_xl: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

title: First Power, The (1990)
synopsis_xl: A dedicated L.A. police detective and a female psychic must stop a demonic serial killer who was given the powers of resurrection, teleportation and possession.

title: Natural Born Killers (1994)
synopsis_xl: Two victims of traumatized childhoods become lovers and psychopathic serial murderers irresponsibly glorified by the mass media.

title: Last House on the Left, The (1972)
synopsis_xl: Two teenage girls heading to a rock concert for one's birthday try to score marijuana in the city, where they are kidnapped and brutalized by a gang of psychopathic convicts.

title: Matrix, The (1999)
synopsis_xl: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

title: Matrix Revolutions, The (2003)
synopsis_xl: The human city of Zion defends itself against the massive invasion of the machines as Neo fights to end the war at another front while also opposing the rogue Agent Smith.

title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)
synopsis_xl: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her 10-year old son John from an even more advanced and powerful cyborg.

title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
synopsis_xl: After the Rebels are overpowered by the Empire, Luke Skywalker begins his Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued across the galaxy by Darth Vader and bounty hunter Boba Fett.

title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
synopsis_xl: After rescuing Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the Rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side.

title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
synopsis_xl: In a time of conflict, a group of unlikely heroes band together on a mission to steal the plans to the Death Star, the Empire's ultimate weapon of destruction.

title: Lost World: Jurassic Park, The (1997)
synopsis_xl: A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda.

title: Jurassic Park III (2001)
synopsis_xl: A decidedly odd couple with ulterior motives convince Dr. Grant to go to Isla Sorna for a holiday, but their unexpected landing startles the island's new inhabitants.

title: Dinosaur (2000)
synopsis_xl: An orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs joins an arduous trek to a sanctuary after a meteorite shower destroys his family home.

title: Schindler's List (1993)
synopsis_xl: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

title: Pianist, The (2002)
synopsis_xl: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

title: Yuva (2004)
synopsis_xl: Michael, Arjun and Lallan, three men from three different strata of society, cross paths one morning in Calcutta and change one another's lives forever.

title: Low Life (1994)
synopsis_xl: Michael, Arjun and Lallan, three men from three different strata of society, cross paths one morning in Calcutta and change one another's lives forever.

title: Honey Moon (Honigmond) (1996)
synopsis_xl: Michael, Arjun and Lallan, three men from three different strata of society, cross paths one morning in Calcutta and change one another's lives forever.

title: Toy Story (1995)
synopsis_xl: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's bedroom.

title: Midnight in a Toy Shop (1930)
synopsis_xl: A spider sneaks in to a toy store and sees the toys come to life as he plays a tune on the toy piano and record player.

title: An Amazing Couple (2002)
synopsis_xl: In the first installment in director Belvaux's trilogy, Alain's eccentric behavior causes his wife, Cecile, to hire a detective to follow his every move -- which yields unexpected results.

title: Rize (2005)
synopsis_xl: Rize chronicles a dance movement that rises out of South Central Los Angeles with roots in clowning and street youth culture.

title: Just Write (1997)
synopsis_xl: A Hollywood tour bus driver poses as a screenwriter to romance an up-and-coming young actress.

title: Mark Twain (2001)
synopsis_xl: A biographical film about the acclaimed American humourist and author.

title: Tender Mercies (1983)
synopsis_xl: A broken-down, middle-aged country singer gets a new wife, reaches out to his long-lost daughter, and tries to put his troubled life back together.

title: Tron (1982)
synopsis_xl: A computer hacker is abducted into the digital world and forced to participate in gladiatorial games where his only chance of escape is with the help of a heroic security program.

title: How to Make a Monster (2001)
synopsis_xl: An evil video game comes to life and hunts the group of developers.

title: Tron (1982)
synopsis_xl: An evil video game comes to life and hunts the group of developers.

title: Eye for an Eye (1996)
synopsis_xl: When the courts fail to keep behind bars the man who raped and murdered her daughter, a woman seeks her own form of justice.

title: Safe House (2012)
synopsis_xl: A young CIA agent is tasked with looking after a fugitive in a safe house. But when the safe house is attacked, he finds himself on the run with his charge.

title: Unforgiven (1992)
synopsis_xl: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan and a young man, The "Schofield Kid."

title: Goodfellas (1990)
synopsis_xl: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
synopsis_xl: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Casablanca (1942)
synopsis_xl: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
synopsis_xl: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

title: Casablanca (1942)
synopsis_xl: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

title: Life Is Beautiful (La Vita è bella) (1997)
synopsis_xl: When an open-minded Jewish waiter and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

title: Red Shoes, The (1948)
synopsis_xl: A young ballet dancer is torn between the man she loves and her pursuit to become a prima ballerina.

title: Spirited Away (Sen to Chihiro no kamikakushi) (2001)
synopsis_xl: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches and spirits, a world where humans are changed into beasts.

title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
synopsis_xl: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (1975)
synopsis_xl: In the Fall of 1963, a Korean War veteran and criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rallies up the scared patients against the tyrannical nurse.

title: Touching the Void (2003)
synopsis_xl: The true story of two climbers and their perilous journey up the west face of Siula Grande in the Peruvian Andes in 1985.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird (1962)
synopsis_xl: Atticus Finch, a widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama, defends a Black man against an undeserved rape charge, and tries to educate his young children against prejudice.

title: Paths of Glory (1957)
synopsis_xl: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

title: Blade Runner (1982)
synopsis_xl: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

title: Trainspotting (1996)
synopsis_xl: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

title: Forrest Gump (1994)
synopsis_xl: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

title: Lee Daniels' The Butler (2013)
synopsis_xl: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.

title: Forrest Gump (1994)
synopsis_xl: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

title: Perfect Blue (1997)
synopsis_xl: A pop singer gives up her career to become an actress, but she slowly goes insane when she starts being stalked by an obsessed fan and what seems to be a ghost of her past.

title: Days of Heaven (1978)
synopsis_xl: A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.

title: Hilary and Jackie (1998)
synopsis_xl: The tragic story of world renowned classic cellist Jacqueline du Pré, as told from the point of view of her sister, flautist Hilary du Pré-Finzi.

title: Jar, The (Khomreh) (1992)
synopsis_xl: In the yard of an Iranian village school stands in the shade of a tree a large stoneware jar from which all the pupils drink fresh water. On an unfortunate day, the jar starts leaking. The schoolmaster tries hard to get a new one but in vain. The only solution is to have it fixed...

title: Secrets & Lies (1996)
synopsis_xl: Following the death of her adoptive parents, a successful young black optometrist establishes contact with her biological mother -- a lonely white factory worker living in poverty in East London.

title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
synopsis_xl: Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love.

title: Naked (1993)
synopsis_xl: An unemployed Mancunian vents his rage on unsuspecting strangers as he embarks on a nocturnal London odyssey.
